messageBody:
Vladimir,

You're absolutely right. When I typed the code, I already was
enlightened, but the habit is *so strong*... :-)
The correct code (to get that C- grade), should be:
} catch( Exception e ){
fail( "FileNotFoundException expected", e );
}

Will your changes also be submitted into the junit framework, or only
into the additions?

Martijn

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Vladimir R. Bossicard" <vladimir@b...>
wrote:
> > testFileNotFound(){
> > try{
> > FooFileLoader f = new FooFileLoader( "unknownfile.txt" );
> > fail( "FileNotFoundException expected, got none" );
> > } catch( FileNotFoundException e ){
> > // success!
> > } catch( Exception e ){
> > fail( "FileNotFoundException expected, caught: " + e );
> > }
> > }
>
> Ok so imagine that your test fails and that a NullPointerException
is
> thrown _somewhere_ in your code.
>
> Here's the output of your test:
>
> There was 1 failure
> 1) testFileNotFound(MyTestClass)
> java.lang.NullPointerException
> at MyTestClass(MyTestClass.java:line_number)
> at ...
>
> Now I ask you: what is the next step you will do to know _where_
the NPE
> has been thrown (since you don't have any stacktrace that could
show you
> the location of the failure)?
